noun.name: skateboard
noun.discription: a small board with wheels, used for riding and performing tricks

object1.name: surfboard
object1.discription: in parallel with 'skateboard', is a long, narrow board used for riding on waves in the ocean

object2.name: snowboard
object2.discription: in parallel with 'skateboard', is a board resembling a short, broad ski, used for descending snow-covered slopes

object3.name: scooter
object3.discription: in parallel with 'skateboard', is a small, wheeled vehicle that can be powered by pedals or an electric motor

object4.name: roller skates
object4.discription: in parallel with 'skateboard', are shoes with wheels, used for gliding on smooth surfaces

object5.name: bicycle
object5.discription: in parallel with 'skateboard', is a two-wheeled vehicle powered by pedaling

object6.name: hoverboard
object6.discription: in parallel with 'skateboard', is a self-balancing, battery-powered scooter

object7.name: longboard
object7.discription: in parallel with 'skateboard', is a larger version of a skateboard, often used for cruising and downhill riding

object8.name: pogo stick
object8.discription: in parallel with 'skateboard', is a device used for bouncing, consisting of a pole with a spring and footpads
